snippet: The scenes of anxious foreigners fleeing by boat recalled the mayhem at the start of the Libyan uprising under Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi in 2011.
abstract: British Navy ship evacuates about 100 British citizens from Tripoli, Libya, as 25 Libyans are reportedly killed in fighting between rival militias raging throughout city; what began as a relatively isolated battle for city's airport has now escalated to constant skirmishes throughout Tripoli; more than 200 are believed to have died in the fighting.

byline.original: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and SULIMAN ALI ZWAY
byline.contributor: David D. Kirkpatrick reported from Cairo, and Suliman Ali Zway from Benghazi, Libya.

lead_paragraph: The scenes of anxious foreigners fleeing by boat recalled the mayhem at the start of the Libyan uprising under Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi in 2011.

headline.main: British Citizens Flee Tripoli on Ship as 25 Libyans Are Reportedly Killed in Fighting
headline.print_headline: British Citizens Flee Tripoli on Ship as 25 Libyans Are Reportedly Killed in Fighting
